kv4.1:0.4_0: Discussion of the proper conduct for a householder
kv4.1:1.7_0: Or a perfected one has no fetter, but doesn’t proceed having turned away from the lay life to homelessness.
kv4.1:2.3_0: Shouldn’t they give up the fetters of rebirth, old age, and death, cut them off at the root, made them like a palm stump, obliterated them, so they’re unable to arise in the future?
kv4.1:2.5_0: Or they’ve given up the fetters of attraction, repulsion, views, doubt, conceit, desire to be reborn, and ignorance.
kv4.1:3.3_0: there is anyone who, without giving up the fetters of rebirth in the present life, make an end of suffering in this very life?
kv4.1:3.5_0: No-one who has given up the fetter of lay life, but without giving up the fetters of suffering in the present life.
kv4.1:4.4_0: “Master Gotama, are there any laypeople who, without giving up the fetter of lay life, make an end of suffering when the body breaks up?”
kv4.1:4.8_0: And they should not correct them like this:
kv4.1:5.3_0: And to have sexual intercourse, as soon as they live, hurting themselves, or wearing garlands and fragrances. They’d wear garlands and fragrances, and makeup; and beds, houses, and lighting up the parts? Or don’t wear garlands and fragrances, and makeup; and money, elephants, horses, and gold and money.
kv4.1:6.1_0: should not correct them like this:
kv4.1:6.4_0: Yasa, doesn’t you have attained perfection at the householder Uggāhamāna, and perfectioned in order to attain perfection?”
kv4.1:6.6_0: He excited a gentleman, puts his bowl in world contracting and expensive verses.
kv4.1:6.8_0: The discussion of a perfected one.’
